name: github_scenario_build_an_application_based_on_the_attached_require
description: Test case for: As a user, I want to build an application based on the attached requirements.

parts.text: build an application based on the attached requirements.

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

I retrieved and saved the 3 attached requirement files to the repository's functional requirements directory so they’re ready for the build step.

Next, tell me how you want to initialize the repository and branch so I can proceed:
- Choose the programming language (Python or Java).
- Choose whether this will use a Cyoda public template or your private repository.
- Choose whether to create a new branch or use an existing branch.

If you pick a Private repo option, I’ll ask you for the Repo URL and the GitHub App Installation ID so I can connect and initialize using the standard Cyoda template. If you pick a Public repo option, I’ll clone the appropriate Cyoda template and create (or checkout) the branch you choose.

[options-single-choice: Python — Public repo — New Branch, Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Python — Private repo — New Branch, Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Public repo — New Branch, Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Private repo — New Branch, Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch]
